meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes something to happen.
meanings.sent1: The causers of the loud noise were the construction workers.
meanings.sent2: The police are investigating the causers of the accident.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was the causer of chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: The storm was the causer of destruction in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The causers of the problem were finally identified and held accountable.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the word 'causer', referring to multiple individuals or things that cause something to happen.
meanings.sent1: The causers of the commotion were the rowdy teenagers.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied the causers of the disease outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppies were the causers of laughter in the park.
meanings.sent4: The causers of change often face resistance from traditionalists.
meanings.sent5: The causers of the misunderstanding were unaware of their impact.
